result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard John Popp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Unlawful Phone Use-Threatens Harm, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
DNA sample to be provided by no later than August 18, 2017 and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard John Popp

defendant.name: Popp, Richard John
defendant.address: N7734 County Road A, Johnson Creek, WI 53038

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 3:16 p.m. Defendant Richard John Popp in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi. Defendant appears telephonically. Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives his right to be personally present in the courtroom. Defendant has complied with the Deferred Sentencing Agreement. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Sentencing recommendation by DA Blader. No statement by DE. Court orders: Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA sample to be provided by no later than August 18, 2017 and surcharge assessed. Appeal rights mailed to DE. Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.
Sentencing hearing on August 7, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

2:33 pm case called. Defendant Richard John Popp in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement stated on record by ADA Anderson-12 mo PPDA.   Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant. Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained.  Consequences explained for failure to abide by terms of PPDA. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest  Court accepts plea and stays JOC.  Court accepts terms and conditions of PPDA.  Matter stayed for 12 months. Court admonishes the defendant regarding conditions of bond.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 3, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi requests plea/sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 3, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on June 28, 2016 at 09:40 am.
Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called Early @ 1:29 PM: Defendant Richard John Popp in court, appearing pro se.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Def does not wish counsel at this time and requests to speak directly with the DA on resolution.  Court finds there has been a waiver of counsel on the record.  Off Record for Def to speak with the DA:  Back of Record at 1:40 PM:  Per DA - due to victim concerns this matter cannot be resolved today.  Def may wish to contact SPD for representation with a possible Atty Authorization.  NGP entered by Court.  Court orders a $1000 Signature Bond w/conditions.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2016 at 09:40 am.
